Reviews.Title: Phones these days
Reviews.Author: Cenile D. Mentia
Reviews.Content: With everyone owning smartphones these days, I'm not even sure if people still buy these anymore. For those who do decide to stick to the good old motto of a phone should just be a phone, this review is for you.And for a phone, this particular one deserves 5 stars.It does what it does well, and it's also incredibly durable and incredibly light(nokia phones like this model have earned a rather legendary status in terms of durability). What boosts this phone to a 5 stars though is ironically its extra features. There's a headphone jack on the top of this phone, and when you plug in a pair of headphones, you can tune in to FM radio. How cool is that?! I mean, even the iPhone doesn't have that. Also, another bonus feature is that it has a flashlight. Works in a pinch if you're stuck in the basement with no electricity or whatever. Finally, this battery lasts... a LONG time. I've gone a whole week before having to charge this.There's no camera here, for those wondering, but most 'dumbphones' with cameras take crappy pictures anyways, so I didn't really care about the lack of one here. Also, for those who text a lot, you might want to consider a phone with a keyboard, since this one doesn't have one. Obviously there's no retina display or whatever here, but it's not like you're going to be looking at the screen all the time like you would with a smartphone.But for those who uses phones as... phones, you can't beat this model at a price point like this. I bought this phone with realistic expectations, and I wasn't disappointed.If you have any questions, feel free to comment.-UPDATE 11/30/12-So with after almost a half year with this phone, I can testify to the durability of this phone. I've dropped it from the top of a bunk bed (on accident of course) multiple times and it still functions fine. No damage to the screen or anything! That's pretty impressive.

Reviews.Title: Awesome (HONEST REVIEW)
Reviews.Author: BME
Reviews.Content: I am a t-mobile customer in the states and have been for a while. they dont have the best service nor the best customer service but we are reviewing a phone not a company.that being said i paid under 28$ with shipping for this product and i am one happy little camper. yes a have owned smart phones the last one a owned was a Galaxy S the first one. it was a tough transition after the screen cracked but im glad i bought it. i spent hundreds of dollars and to buy a phone that does not scratch on impacts is great. Nokia is a solid build quality and they last long.Pros: Durable- very sturdy ive dropped it so much these few months ive had it and i see not a scratch on it. i dont drop it at massive heights usually off a table or off the arm rest on to a hardwood floor and once in a while on concrete.Radio/headset- its a cool feature to walk around with a radio with a more than recent signal qualitylight- yes its feather weight compared to everything on this planet. it so light i forget its in my pocketall the features i need- decent texting abilities buttons arent to big i have big hands so its tough but i still think its fantasticcall quality- is good. not the sharpest but louder than sharper sound quality which is a plus becuase although you hear wind and all the background sounds a bit more you never complain about volume.standard headjack- it comes in handyCons: NONE ITS 20 BUCKSHONESTLY IF YOU WANT YOURSELF A PHONE GET IT!! it will not disappoint you get more than what you pay for

Reviews.Title: Makes/Receives Phone Calls, Easy to Write Texts, Does What You Want a Phone to Do
Reviews.Author: James N Simpson
Reviews.Content: This is simply a review of the actual Nokia 1616 handset, not T-Mobile or whatever carrier or prepay service Amazon is packaging with it on this page.  This review is simply for people like I was, who when their old phone has died, need to get another cheap one, and are looking for info on the ones they've seen in junk mail catalogues, online websites or in the isles of department stores to make sure they are not buying a dud.To be honest with you, I made the decision to buy this pretty much on price, it was the cheapest I came across at short notice when my old phone suddenly died, at $19.  I don't need a phone to take photos, I've got a camera for that (although this phone can receive photo texts). I don't need it to go online to visit Facebook, E-bay, Amazon or other websites, I've got a computer to do that. I don't even really need it to send texts, I use Facebook to send messages to everyone I don't want to call, but I did send one to my mum who shuns fancy things like the Internet and it was simple, quick and easy to do using this phone. I've only owned three mobile phones in my life and this really is no better or worse than the other two which were both Motorolas, the last being the WX160, which also is a good cheap phone to get if you can still find one.It is a bit heavier and bulkier than my previous phones but still overall is pretty light.  You hardly notice it if you carry it in your pants pocket.  Comes with a flashlight at the top, bit of a gimmick really, I always just used the display screen on my previous phones as a flashlight, however this one's display screen is not as illuminating as those phones and the flashlight does do a nice job with a small concentrated light beam. Possibly doing it this way saves battery power and lengthens the time between charges if you don't use the torch, I don't know. It's not powerful enough that you'd substitute it for a decent torch if camping or something and wanting to avoid stepping on a poisonous snake or falling down a hole, but it's decent enough if you're sleeping in a dorm room in a backpacker hostel or something and everyone else is asleep with the lights off to navigate your way past everyone's discarded belongings on the floor.  It has a number of different wallpaper pictures you can set for the background, I must honest none of them really thrilled me with a wow isn't that cool moment.  I went with the green lizard but there's flowers and patterns and things like this is you prefer.  The menu is pretty easy to navigate, with easy to understand icons, things like setting the date are very easy.  Has some games on it, they're not very good I looked at them but can't see myself ever doing so again.  These may be different for whatever country you're in but on the phones sold in Australia they are Rapid Roll, Bounce and Forbidden Treasures. The Nokia 1616 has quite a number of ringtones including the Nokia theme.  I wasn't overly excited by any of these either and if you're like me and have a mobile phone because you are on call for work and need to be able to hear your phone before the person on the other end hangs up if it is at the other end of your house, about two thirds of the ringtones are useless.Like most phones in this price range it comes with an FM radio.  You can listen to it like a Walkman, the headphones are provided and it interrupts the radio if an incoming call happens.  Like all similar priced phones though the only headphones that fit the hole to plug into the phone, are the set it comes with. My previous phone I misplaced those early on so expect that feature to not last that long as I'm likely to do that again.  The radio is easy to tune into the station you want simply by typing the number like you would a text.  The buttons on the keypad are each individually raised and a decent size by the way.The phone actually comes with a nice little instruction booklet and not just the usual folded bit of double-sided large bit of paper. The battery comes slightly charged which is nice if like I was you're on call for work.  Doesn't take too long to charge either.  Putting in the Sim card is a bit tricky though, the illustrations on the box aren't that clear you've got to make sure it goes under that metal thing.The only thing that really annoys me about this phone is that is sort of goes into computer monitor style sleep mode after a couple of seconds of non use.  I used to love being able to see the time and even the date when needed on my old phone simply by glancing at it.  You've got to hit the centre square button to wake up the phone and see the time with the Nokia 1616, meaning you've got to touch the phone and not just subtly glance at on the table it if in a meeting or just having a conversation with someone a lunchtime or something.  I don't really know what the selling point of that feature is at all, it's something Nokia should get rid of on future phones. It's not like the time ever burnt into the display on my other phones.  You can also get the clock to speak the time if you're into that sort of thing.It does have quite a bulky recharger compared to my previous phones, meaning it sticks out a fair bit from the wall power point limiting due to furniture and things like this the places you can plug it in.  It only lasts four or five days at most between charges especially if it has been receiving or making calls, which is about half the time of my previous two phones.If you want a reliable phone to make and take calls as well as text, and this one is selling for a cheap price, it does the job. No more, and more importantly no less.

Reviews.Title: Indestructible !
Reviews.Author: Jr
Reviews.Content: My now 12 year old son has had this phone for about 4 years. This is a great phone for a young child that you may not want to add on tonyour contracted plan. This phone has been dropped, it has been washed and dried twice due to my son forgetting it in his pocket and it is still going strong. This a great phone for emergency use. The battery is still going strong, we only charge it once or twice a week at the most.

Reviews.Title: Good cheap phone
Reviews.Author: M. Giganti
Reviews.Content: No problem with this phone. Long stand by battery life. Can't beat the price. Bought a gel cover to protect it and it feels much sturdier now. The only sad thing is you cannot download new ringtones to it.

Reviews.Title: Cheap phone
Reviews.Author: Garcia
Reviews.Content: My son has autisum and it has been very hard to get him to learn how to use a androiod type of phone.  He loves this.

Reviews.Title: Terrible sound level
Reviews.Author: cake-oh
Reviews.Content: We have only owned cheap phones and have never had a data plan and have only recently done much texting, so I am not comparing this phone to the expensive phones.  We had an old (also cheap) Nokia that was a forerunner to this, and I liked it much better.  While this phone does, in fact, function as a phone like so many other reviewers have specified, the sound levels have diminished to the point that it is really difficult to hear what is being spoken on the other end.  And it doesn't much matter if it makes/receives calls if I cannot hear anything.  (As a side note, I am not hard of hearing and have the volume on the lowest setting on my other phones.)

Reviews.Title: Nice and simple
Reviews.Author: T. Ulrich
Reviews.Content: In response to the smartphone explosion, I decided to get a simpler phone. And this one is a great pick. Its very lightweight and easy to use, does what I need it to without turning into a lifestyle. The flashlight is great since I do lots of work in tight spaces and could use one in a jam! The texting has one of those predictive style programs which - once disabled - is much more helpful.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my dad
Reviews.Author: Lynn K. Whaley
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent purchase and was exactly as described by the seller.  Proved to complicated for Dad, but my son loves it.  It came in the original box, unopened and ready to activate.

Reviews.Title: great for the price and  like the fm radio
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: I only use my phone for basic calls and an occasional text which is why I have a prepaid phone at 10 cents per minute. I dont want to pay all that money to the cell phone companys for the smart phones and internet although if I had the extra cash I would. This Nokia 1616 is a great bonus for people like me because you get an fm radio with it. I like this feature very much. I only have had this phone for a day but I already prefer it over the  Samsung T139 Prepaid Phone I  replaced with this. Seems to have a stronger signal tha the Samsung T139 Prepaid Phone. I went to the zoo today and I thought it was great to have a radio with me. I had the radio on for about three hours and it didnt seem to use any battery juice. This doesnt have a camera but I have a subcompact camera I carry for pictures so that isnt a problem. The radio has 10 presets and receives signals clearly.

Reviews.Title: Dissatisfied. Return?
Reviews.Author: Asia Allison
Reviews.Content: It doesn't work. Wont turn on. Tried numerous chargers,  seems to be a problem with the phone itself. Is it too late to do a refund? It was a gift so I Never checked it,  just wrapped it up

Reviews.Title: The phone is good for basic feature which is what I need
Reviews.Author: K. H. Wu
Reviews.Content: I had this phone couple years ago. It was good. It had good battery life. It is durable.I eventually replaced this one because of my fault.One day I was walking an hour. The phone was in my pocket. Everything got wet including this cell Phone. My co-worker plucked out the batteries and let it stand for couple seconds. It works. Of course, the condition of battery dropped significantly. The phone was still good. Then one day, I was chasing the train, I missed the train. Then I realized my phone dropped on the floor. The whole thing felt part. I had to put battery and everything back. The second blow actually cause some damage. It still worked. Of course, the reception started to get worst. It was still good phone. That was 4 years after I purchased the phone. Instead of charging phone once a week, I had to charge the phone every 2 day. Once a while, I had connection problem. I loved that phone. Then I had to travel abroad. This is a simple phone. I need a quad band phone. Since this phone is getting old with damage. I think it is time to retire this phone and get a better phoneIf you are looking for a cell phone for talking to someone (isn't that the purpose of the inventing cell phone), this serves the purpose. Don't expect this one to work in the foreign country. This is a dual band phone. I am not too crazy about texting, but once a while I want to text small piece information instead of talking on the phone for 5 minutes, it could be a pain. People who use the phone for talking, this is a durable and battery life is good.Nokia makes good phone. Unfortunately, everyone is going to expensive smart phone. Nokia is going to die because it is behind on smart phones. It is hard to find Nokia regular phone.I have another Motorola phone for 5 years. it is still good, but battery is getting worse. I have hard time finding the dumb phone. I am not paying more than 100 for smart phones. I am still trying to find my Nokia quad band phones. If possible, I want to get qwerty keyboard just in case some one asked me to text 20 word messages such as my address.I may pick this one if I could not find other cheaper Nokia quad band phone. I really miss this phone

Reviews.Title: Works fine for what I need
Reviews.Author: Bob Tyler
Reviews.Content: OK, this is my emergency phone. I will only use it to take with me for calling AutoClub or the hospital! (I don't have another cell-phone). So for that purpose it seems fine. It is slim, light, fairly easy to use. Takes and receives call fine, audio quality acceptable. I don't know if it's just the one I got, but the menu is a little wonky. Sometimes it comes up, sometimes not. I dunno, maybe I'm not pushing the buttons hard enough. Anyway, Moot Point because I won't use the extra stuff much, if at all. Well, maybe the FM radio on a walk - that's pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: Got what i wanted but not what i paid for
Reviews.Author: Abby Eger
Reviews.Content: Needed a replacement for my charger and phone (screen was cracked). Phone and charger were fine, came with an incompatible battery. Looking into partial refund.

Reviews.Title: Nokia 1616 Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: James Simmons
Reviews.Content: I carry a cell phone to make and receive calls and do a little texting.  This phone is great and you can hardly beat the price. Great reception, long battery life and is simple and easy to use. For another $12 or so I added a really cool case that snaps right over the phone. I purchased this phone because I fear it may not be available much longer. Why sign a two year contract to get a phone when you can buy one this nice w/case for less than $36 and stay contract free!

Reviews.Title: It is what it is
Reviews.Author: shevil
Reviews.Content: As far as phones go, its just that "a phone" Just like everyone that has a computer at home and their office, I don't need a smart phone. It doesn't need to be charged that much, but, it doesn't work that good for text's, oh well, for the price, you can't lose.

Reviews.Title: Drops calls w/o warning, sound stopped working altogether after 8 months
Reviews.Author: Marissa
Reviews.Content: I had bought this phone as a backup and it was used very minimally, only for a weekly phone call with some relatives while walking home from work. This phone was fine for around 6 months, and had some interesting features such as a flashlight function, and the UI was fairly intuitive. However, after 6 months, calls began dropping randomly, and by about the 8th month, the sound stopped working altogether - so I would make calls and be unable to hear the person on the other side.Other dumbphones I've had in the past (sony ericson t610, motorola razr v3r) lasted for 3-4 years before any degrade in functionality - and even then it was minor things such as decreased battery life or lower volume levels. I was completely disappointed by how fast this phone stopped function.

Reviews.Title: If you need a very basic celphone this works great.
Reviews.Author: Charles Lyons
Reviews.Content: It does the job, good quality, hardy, and battery life is long.Cons: Buttons are small for some..for those with thick fingers.

Reviews.Title: modestly priced and without all the annoying features I don't want!
Reviews.Author: J. Brown
Reviews.Content: {Probably perfect for that family member who doesn't want a complicated phone. Easily navigated, large buttons, and a clear window display....perfect!  It seems to last forever on a single battery charge.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Mary Dodson
Reviews.Content: This Nokia 1616 is so easy to use. The size is convenient to carry. It has all the capabilities I need.

Reviews.Title: Lookin for a good resonable phone consider this one NOKIA 1616
Reviews.Author: Adesh R.
Reviews.Content: It is one of a kind works very well and durable to, I highly recommend it for any one who is lookin for a good phone.

Reviews.Title: HIGHLY UNRELIABLE PRIMARY
Reviews.Author: Gene F.
Reviews.Content: BAD: - Drops calls every time you change towers, which makes it utterly useless on the road. - Drops calls if you're going for a walk - Occasionally loses network signal when stationary for 30 seconds at a time - Occasionally resetsGOOD: - Battery life - LED flashlight

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: ABC
Reviews.Content: Need a new phone as mine broke, works fine with t-mobile sim card.  Just what I needed for a low model phone that does what I needed.

Reviews.Title: Issue with picture messages
Reviews.Author: R. TA "Roger"
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by other reviewers, this phone is a very basic phone, without an OK button in the middle of the 4 side toggle. But this phone has a serious bug (at least when used with T-Mobile): it can't accept picture messages; worse, when it gets a picture message, it will not display the originating phone number that sent the picture message; instead it will display an error code (like 202, 208, etc.). When you select the message to view its content, the phone says "Message cannot be displayed". Therefore, you won't be able to tell who sent you the picture message to ask him/her to stop sending picture messages to your phone. T-Mobile won't be able to tell you the originating phone number either. The only thing T-Mobile can help is to block all incoming text messages for this phone.

Reviews.Title: Got it quick
Reviews.Author: cindy
Reviews.Content: THE PHONE WORKS FINE AND WAS DELIVERED QUICK.  PROBLEM WAS THE CHARGER DID NOT WORK AT ALL.  HAD TO SPEND $15 FOR ONE.  THE PHONE WAS $17.  I was going to send it back, but decided to keep it.  It is for emergencies and no more.  No frills at all!

Reviews.Title: Just a headache.
Reviews.Author: Shop girl
Reviews.Content: Phone arrived early which was good. Package looked new and sealed but the SIM card was already activated and could not be used at all.  Called T-Mobile to see if they can help me find a solution to this already activated SIM Card? After fourty five minutes on hold with a T-Mobile rep and explaining the details of the online purchase, the rep will send me a new SIM card for this phone.  You are better off going to an actual T-Mobile store location than ordering it online.

Reviews.Title: THIS WORKS BEST FOR US
Reviews.Author: NHN
Reviews.Content: WORKS BEST FOR US!GREAT - Just what we need for a Bluetooth capable phone for the car! Easy to operate and see text.

Reviews.Title: Fine for the price
Reviews.Author: Gryszpanowicz
Reviews.Content: Pros:*This phone is light-weight and small, so it's easy to carry around.*I love that it has an alarm clock and it will still work even if the phone is turned off! (note cons)*I've dropped it a couple times, and it still works.*Flashlight certainly comes in handy, as well as the stopwatch.Cons:*It will shut off on me randomly (not when I'm actually talking), but it seems to happen mostly when I have bad reception.*The snooze does not always work.*You have to plug in the earphones in order to hear the radio - including using the radio as an alarm clock. Kind of annoying.*The square middle button has a ridge around it that gets kind of annoying.  Not a major problem, though.*Graphics are not exactly impressive, but for the price, what can I say?

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Regular Phone
Reviews.Author: zachwulf
Reviews.Content: I got this phone because I wanted a durable phone that just did a few things, and did them right.Pros:- Durable, able to take a beating. I've already dropped and smashed it several times, still working- Call quality is great, you can hear others clearly and your voice comes through perfect- Nice, simple interface- Plenty of extra features like an alarm, basic calendar and a built-in led flashlightCons:- The buttons are really loud and make an annoying click sound when pressed.- The SMS interface is really clunky; it takes quite a few steps just to send one message- That center button isn't actually a button, which is kind of counter-intuitive.- It's pretty small, it's really easy to fat-finger buttonsOverall though, you can't go wrong with this phone for 30 bucks. It's a great basic phone for people who just want to make calls.

Reviews.Title: bsolete phone but works like a charm for simple calls and texts
Reviews.Author: Tehya
Reviews.Content: Oand is surprisingly very strong because I dropped it many, many times without the cover on and it didn't show any sign of damage. Simple phone for an incredibly low, low price.

Reviews.Title: T-Mobile Nokia 1616 Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: R. Hancock "road ranger"
Reviews.Content: This phone is exactly what I was looking for. All the functions are very easy to understand and operate. For a phone to make a quick call without a lot of extra features to get in the way or eat up battery life, it is ideal. I love it.

Reviews.Title: great, inexpensive replacement phone for kid
Reviews.Author: ls "plain and simple"
Reviews.Content: My son broke his T-Mobile cell phone (that cost $16).  I couldn't find a low cost replacement at T-Mobile, but did find a few on Amazon. The Nokia 1616 works fine!

Reviews.Title: Not worth purchasing
Reviews.Author: Debbie Chase
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my husband since his older cell phone just stopped working.  He just needed this as a spare to call the family because we have a family plan.  He has a smart phone that he uses for business.  He complained all the time about the phone not getting reception, calls dropped all the time or just could not make calls.  He ended up just pulling a much older spare phone I forgot from the garage and it worked better than this one ever did.

Reviews.Title: good phone, good price
Reviews.Author: jturner
Reviews.Content: I think that at $25 this is a GREAT PHONE. But I got it for 40, so it's good. makes calls, doesn't cost an arm and a leg.

Reviews.Title: Great backup phone
Reviews.Author: Rafshan Caesar
Reviews.Content: I use this as a backup phone and it has served me well in that aspect. Lost my phone one day and this made a good replacement until I purchased another phone in respect.

Reviews.Title: A perfect phone.
Reviews.Author: Adarsh
Reviews.Content: This is a the perfect phone. Does not have anything extra other than the phone requirements. No Camera, No LTE/4G. Precisely what I wanted. Speaker quality is good. I can hear what others speak and others can hear what I speak.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product as are the expected and was there on the notice
Reviews.Author: ARRIETA NEURO
Reviews.Content: Excellent product as are the expected and was there on the notice, however thought to use it in other operating

Reviews.Title: nokia cheap
Reviews.Author: Christa R. Valles "BUSY MOM"
Reviews.Content: This phone is a piece of crap. It turn off all of sudden even on a full battery I have only had it less than a month. It does have good battery life and it is very small and compact. Other than that its not worth the money. Wish it would stay on like it is supposed to.

Reviews.Title: NOKIA 1616 Is Trash!
Reviews.Author: Linda W.
Reviews.Content: First of all the Battery They Provided Would Not Charge, So I Purchesed A Neww BNattery, Next The Phone Opperated OK for Two Or Three Weeks Then Quit Working,I Would Advise, DO NOT BUY THIS JUNK PHONE!

Reviews.Title: very poor
Reviews.Author: onealski
Reviews.Content: Had to take it in to get a card inserted; it didn't work right.  There's a tinny sound in it.  I think it was probably a return and recycled.  Very poor product.

Reviews.Title: too expensive
Reviews.Author: Fuchang Wang
Reviews.Content: Battery could work for 6~7 days without recharging. A flash light is available. No Internet, no radio( although there is a radio iterm on the screen),  alarm clock can only be set once a time.

Reviews.Title: Phone: 3 stars, Service: 2 stars
Reviews.Author: For Real "HAND"
Reviews.Content: First, about T-Mobile's service: it usually sucks. I live in a metro area and get full strength reception on my Nokia Lumia 920 4G Windows Phone, Black (AT&T;) (simply the best smartphone!), but can barely get 1 bar on this phone or other T-Mobile phones (Alcatel, T-Mo's own brand, etc.) -- and that's when I stand next to my windows! If I move to the bedroom, forget about it, there's no bar and I can't make or take calls. Calls drop frequently, too. This is why T-Mobile's network is always ranked dead last nationwide.  The reason I chose T-Mobile for my family's prepaid needs (prepaid is great for keeping track of the kids) and reception generally seems okay outdoors, which is fine for my needs.Next, about the phone. It's small and cute and has good battery life. Calls, when I can make them, come through loud and clear. The screen is decent for its size. But the UI has a distinct Europe bend which means it's not all that friendly to American users. For example, I have small hands but those buttons are even too small for me. The tools menu is a mess and cannot be customized. Worst of them all, the calendar's functionality is simply crazy! Weeks start on Monday, so I always misread the calendar. The way appointments are kept is simply pure evil: get this... when you have multiple events on the same day, you cannot view them all on the screen! It only shows one at a time. For some reason you sometimes can suppress event notifications but other times cannot. If you can overlook these weird UI shortcomings, it's a solid phone for making calls. So I finally decided to migrate my kids' simple calendars to my Nokia 920, much to their consternation.In summary, if you just want a basic prepaid phone, this works, and it's really cute and pocketable and tossable, unlike smartphones. (My Nokia 920 is one stylish and tough phone but not always pocketable in the summer.) If you don't mind getting on the T-Mobile network, this may be the best prepaid option for you, especially if you choose the $30 monthly plan or refill $100 to get to the golden status, which makes all future refills last one year.

Reviews.Title: Tooo Cheap!
Reviews.Author: Felix John Montoya "the great cat"
Reviews.Content: Too cheaply made I will look for something better! I know I was looking for something economical but wow cheeeeapppp!

Reviews.Title: Why did I order these phones?
Reviews.Author: love huki
Reviews.Content: I bought these phones to give away free and no one wants them. FREE, I am offering them FREE and nobody wants one. Why on earth did I buy these phones? Never again. No one wants a phone, they all want touchscreen gadgets.

Reviews.Title: If you don't want a locked phone, don't get this one
Reviews.Author: yonutzky
Reviews.Content: The physical phone itself is great. I hate that it comes locked for T-Mobile. I have an AT&T; plan. I needed a decoded phone. The seller did not specify it is coded for T-Mobile

Reviews.Title: did not fulfill my expectations
Reviews.Author: yanz merida
Reviews.Content: I honestly do not no use to the phone since it could not activate it in my country Venezuela. as I have to validate it and I do not think! and that said publication in the international use and is only for the U.S.

ProductInfo.Features:
# Large color display # Long lasting anti-dust keypad # FM radio enabled with 3.5 mm AV connector (works with separate headset) # Flashlight
# User changeable color covers # Large SMS storage (up to 250) # Phonebook with up to 500 entries # Multiple phonebooks # Calendar with reminders # MP3-grade ringtones
ProductInfo.Name: T-Mobile Nokia 1616 Prepaid Cell Phone
